授業目的:
The subtitle of this course is - The History of the English Language.
The purpose of this course is to describe the changes in the development of the English language.
到達目標: Students will be able to understand the reasons for the spelling/pronunciation problems in English.
授業方法:
Pair work.
Individual work.
Information for students permitted to take online classes.
The teacher will send all the worksheets to the student and the students will read the worksheets and complete summaries. This will include the work on the hyperlinks included. Students will have to have a short 1-to-1 zoom meeting with the teacher once a week. The day and time of the meeting can be arranged during Week 1 by email.

第2回: The beginnings - where do European languages come from?
第3回: Old English - the first appearances around 650AD.
第4回: The Normans - French-speaking conquerors change the language from 1066AD.
第5回: Middle English - the language becomes recognizable from around 1300AD.
第6回: The Bible and English - how translations of the Bible influenced modern English.
第7回: Shakespeare and English - English in the time of Shakespeare.

Summary of classwork.
Prepare for mid-term test.
第9回: Early modern English - novels, religion, and empire.
第10回: Modern English - the language we use today.
第11回: All around the world - varieties of English around the world.
第12回: The future - how will English change?
第13回: Review lesson - a review of the course and a chance to ask any questions as necessary.

Summary of classwork.
Prepare for final test.
